text: Ten cubits shall be the length of a frame and a cubit and a half the width of each frame.
speaker: Narrator

text: There shall be two pegs in each frame to fit the frames together; you shall make these for all the frames of the tabernacle.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall make the frames for the tabernacle: twenty frames for the south side;
speaker: Narrator

text: and you shall make forty bases of silver under the twenty frames: two bases under the first frame for its two pegs and two bases under the next frame for its two pegs;
speaker: Narrator

text: and for the second side of the tabernacle, on the north side twenty frames,
speaker: Narrator

text: and their forty bases of silver: two bases under the first frame and two bases under the next frame;
speaker: Narrator

text: and for the rear of the tabernacle westward you shall make six frames.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall make two frames for corners of the tabernacle in the rear;
speaker: Narrator

text: they shall be separate beneath but joined at the top at the first ring; it shall be the same with both of them; they shall form the two corners.
speaker: Narrator

text: And so there shall be eight frames, with their bases of silver, sixteen bases: two bases under the first frame and two bases under the next frame.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall make bars of acacia wood: five for the frames of one side of the tabernacle,
speaker: Narrator

text: and five bars for the frames of the other side of the tabernacle, and five bars for the frames of the side of the tabernacle at the rear westward.
speaker: Narrator

text: The middle bar, halfway up the frames, shall pass through from end to end.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall overlay the frames with gold and shall make their rings of gold to hold the bars, and you shall overlay the bars with gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then you shall erect the tabernacle according to the plan for it that you were shown on the mountain.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall make a curtain of blue, purple, and crimson yarns and of fine twisted linen; it shall be made with cherubim skillfully worked into it.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall hang it on four pillars of acacia overlaid with gold, which have hooks of gold and rest on four bases of silver.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall hang the curtain under the clasps and bring the ark of the covenant in there, within the curtain, and the curtain shall separate for you the holy place from the most holy place.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall put the cover on the ark of the covenant in the most holy place.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall set the table outside the curtain and the lampstand on the south side of the tabernacle opposite the table, and you shall put the table on the north side.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall make a screen for the entrance of the tent, of blue, purple, and crimson yarns and of fine twisted linen, embroidered with needlework.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall make for the screen five pillars of acacia and overlay them with gold; their hooks shall be of gold, and you shall cast five bases of bronze for them.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall make the altar of acacia wood, five cubits long and five cubits wide; the altar shall be square, and it shall be three cubits high.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall make horns for it on its four corners; its horns shall be of one piece with it, and you shall overlay it with bronze.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall make pots for its ashes and shovels and basins and forks and firepans; you shall make all its utensils of bronze.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall also make for it a grating, a network of bronze, and on the net you shall make four bronze rings at its four corners.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall set it under the ledge of the altar so that the net shall extend halfway down the altar.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall make poles for the altar, poles of acacia wood, and overlay them with bronze;
speaker: Narrator

text: the poles shall be put through the rings, so that the poles shall be on the two sides of the altar when it is carried.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall make it hollow, with boards. They shall be made just as you were shown on the mountain.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall make the court of the tabernacle. On the south side the court shall have hangings of fine twisted linen one hundred cubits long for that side;
speaker: Narrator

text: its twenty pillars and their twenty bases shall be of bronze, but the hooks of the pillars and their bands shall be of silver.
speaker: Narrator

text: Likewise for its length on the north side there shall be hangings one hundred cubits long, their pillars twenty and their bases twenty, of bronze, but the hooks of the pillars and their bands shall be of silver.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the width of the court on the west side there shall be fifty cubits of hangings, with ten pillars and ten bases.
speaker: Narrator

text: The width of the court on the front to the east shall be fifty cubits.
speaker: Narrator

text: There shall be fifteen cubits of hangings on one side, with three pillars and three bases.
speaker: Narrator

text: There shall be fifteen cubits of hangings on the other side, with three pillars and three bases.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the gate of the court there shall be a screen twenty cubits long, of blue, purple, and crimson yarns and of fine twisted linen, embroidered with needlework; it shall have four pillars and with them four bases.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the pillars around the court shall be banded with silver; their hooks shall be of silver and their bases of bronze.
speaker: Narrator

text: The length of the court shall be one hundred cubits, the width fifty, and the height five cubits, with hangings of fine twisted linen and bases of bronze.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the utensils of the tabernacle for every use, and all its pegs and all the pegs of the court, shall be of bronze.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall further command the Israelites to bring you pure oil of beaten olives for the light, so that a lamp may be set up to burn continually.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the tent of meeting, outside the curtain that is before the covenant, Aaron and his sons shall tend it from evening to morning before the Lord. It shall be a perpetual ordinance to be observed throughout their generations by the Israelites.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Then bring near to you your brother Aaron and his sons with him, from among the Israelites, to serve me as priests—Aaron and Aaron’s sons: Nadab and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall make sacred vestments for the glorious adornment of your brother Aaron.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall speak to all who are skillful, whom I have endowed with skill, so that they make Aaron’s vestments to consecrate him for my priesthood.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the vestments that they shall make: a breastpiece, an ephod, a robe, a checkered tunic, a turban, and a sash. When they make these sacred vestments for your brother Aaron and his sons to serve me as priests,
speaker: Narrator

text: they shall use gold, blue, purple, and crimson yarns and fine linen.
speaker: Narrator

text: “They shall make the ephod of gold, of blue, purple, and crimson yarns, and of fine twisted linen, skillfully worked.
speaker: Narrator

text: It shall have two shoulder pieces attached to its two edges, so that it may be joined together.
speaker: Narrator

text: The decorated band on it shall be of the same workmanship and materials, of gold, of blue, purple, and crimson yarns, and of fine twisted linen.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall take two onyx stones and engrave on them the names of the sons of Israel,
speaker: Narrator

text: six of their names on the one stone and the names of the remaining six on the other stone, in the order of their birth.
speaker: Narrator

text: As a gem cutter engraves signets, so you shall engrave the two stones with the names of the sons of Israel; you shall mount them in settings of gold filigree.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall set the two stones on the shoulder pieces of the ephod, as stones of remembrance for the sons of Israel, and Aaron shall bear their names before the Lord on his two shoulders for remembrance.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall make settings of gold filigree
speaker: Narrator

text: and two chains of pure gold, twisted like cords, and you shall attach the corded chains to the settings.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall make a breastpiece of judgment, in skilled work; you shall make it in the style of the ephod; of gold, of blue, purple, and crimson yarns, and of fine twisted linen you shall make it.
speaker: Narrator

text: It shall be square and doubled, a span in length and a span in width.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall set in it four rows of stones. A row of carnelian, chrysolite, and emerald shall be the first row;
speaker: Narrator

text: and the second row a turquoise, a sapphire, and a moonstone;
speaker: Narrator

text: and the third row a jacinth, an agate, and an amethyst;
speaker: Narrator

text: and the fourth row a beryl, an onyx, and a jasper; they shall be set in gold filigree.
speaker: Narrator

text: There shall be twelve stones with names corresponding to the names of the sons of Israel; they shall be like signets, each engraved with its name, for the twelve tribes.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall make for the breastpiece chains of pure gold, twisted like cords,
speaker: Narrator

text: and you shall make for the breastpiece two rings of gold and put the two rings on the two edges of the breastpiece.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall put the two cords of gold in the two rings at the edges of the breastpiece;
speaker: Narrator

text: the two ends of the two cords you shall attach to the two settings and so attach it in front to the shoulder pieces of the ephod.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall make two rings of gold and put them at the two ends of the breastpiece, on its inside edge next to the ephod.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall make two rings of gold and attach them in front to the lower part of the two shoulder pieces of the ephod, at its joining above the decorated band of the ephod.
speaker: Narrator

text: The breastpiece shall be bound by its rings to the rings of the ephod with a blue cord, so that it may lie on the decorated band of the ephod and so that the breastpiece shall not come loose from the ephod.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Aaron shall bear the names of the sons of Israel in the breastpiece of judgment on his heart when he goes into the holy place, for a continual remembrance before the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the breastpiece of judgment you shall put the Urim and the Thummim, and they shall be on Aaron’s heart when he goes in before the Lord; thus Aaron shall bear the judgment of the Israelites on his heart before the Lord continually.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall make the robe of the ephod all of blue.
speaker: Narrator

text: It shall have an opening for the head in the middle of it, with a woven binding around its edge, like the opening in a garment, so that it may not be torn.
speaker: Narrator

text: On its lower hem you shall make pomegranates of blue, purple, and crimson yarns, all around the lower hem, with bells of gold between them all around—
speaker: Narrator

text: a golden bell and a pomegranate alternating all around the lower hem of the robe.
speaker: Narrator

text: Aaron shall wear it when he ministers, and its sound shall be heard when he goes into the holy place before the Lord and when he comes out, so that he may not die.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall make a rosette of pure gold and engrave on it, like the engraving of a signet, ‘Holy to the Lord.’
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall fasten it on the turban with a blue cord; it shall be on the front of the turban.
speaker: Narrator

text: It shall be on Aaron’s forehead, and Aaron shall take on himself any guilt incurred in the holy offerings that the Israelites consecrate as their sacred donations; it shall always be on his forehead, in order that they may find favor before the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall make the checkered tunic of fine linen, and you shall make a turban of fine linen, and you shall make a sash embroidered with needlework.
speaker: Narrator

text: “For Aaron’s sons you shall make tunics and sashes and headdresses; you shall make them for their glorious adornment.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall put them on your brother Aaron and on his sons with him and shall anoint them and ordain them and consecrate them, so that they may serve me as priests.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall make for them linen undergarments to cover their naked flesh; they shall reach from the hips to the thighs;
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall be worn by Aaron and his sons when they go into the tent of meeting or when they come near the altar to minister in the holy place, so that they do not bring guilt on themselves and die. This shall be a perpetual ordinance for him and for his descendants after him.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Now this is what you shall do to them to consecrate them to serve me as priests. Take one young bull and two rams without blemish,
speaker: Narrator

text: and unleavened bread, unleavened cakes mixed with oil, and unleavened wafers spread with oil. You shall make them of choice wheat flour.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall put them in one basket and bring them in the basket and bring the bull and the two rams.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall bring Aaron and his sons to the entrance of the tent of meeting and wash them with water.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then you shall take the vestments and put on Aaron the tunic and the robe of the ephod and the ephod and the breastpiece and gird him with the decorated band of the ephod,
speaker: Narrator

text: and you shall set the turban on his head and put the holy diadem on the turban.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall take the anointing oil and pour it on his head and anoint him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then you shall bring his sons and put tunics on them,
speaker: Narrator

text: and you shall gird them, Aaron and his sons, with sashes and tie headdresses on them, and the priesthood shall be theirs by a perpetual ordinance. You shall then ordain Aaron and his sons.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall bring the bull in front of the tent of meeting. Aaron and his sons shall lay their hands on the head of the bull,
speaker: Narrator

text: and you shall slaughter the bull before the Lord, at the entrance of the tent of meeting,
speaker: Narrator

text: and shall take some of the blood of the bull and put it on the horns of the altar with your finger, and all the rest of the blood you shall pour out at the base of the altar.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall take all the fat that covers the entrails and the appendage of the liver and the two kidneys with the fat that is on them and turn them into smoke on the altar.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the flesh of the bull and its skin and its dung you shall burn with fire outside the camp. It is a purification offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Then you shall take one of the rams, and Aaron and his sons shall lay their hands on the head of the ram,
speaker: Narrator

text: and you shall slaughter the ram and shall take its blood and dash it against all sides of the altar.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then you shall cut the ram into its parts and wash its entrails and its legs and put them with its parts and its head
speaker: Narrator

text: and turn the rest of the ram into smoke on the altar. It is a burnt offering to the Lord; it is a pleasing odor, an offering by fire to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall take the other ram, and Aaron and his sons shall lay their hands on the head of the ram,
speaker: Narrator

text: and you shall slaughter the ram and take some of its blood and put it on the lobe of Aaron’s right ear and on the lobes of the right ears of his sons and on the thumbs of their right hands and on the big toes of their right feet and dash the rest of the blood against all sides of the altar.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then you shall take some of the blood that is on the altar and some of the anointing oil and sprinkle it on Aaron and his vestments and on his sons and his sons’ vestments with him; then he and his vestments shall be holy, as well as his sons and his sons’ vestments with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall also take the fat of the ram, the fatty tail, the fat that covers the entrails, the appendage of the liver, the two kidneys with the fat that is on them, and the right thigh (for it is a ram of ordination),
speaker: Narrator

text: and one loaf of bread, one cake of bread made with oil, and one wafer, out of the basket of unleavened bread that is before the Lord,
speaker: Narrator

text: and you shall place all these on the palms of Aaron and on the palms of his sons and raise them as an elevation offering before the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then you shall take them from their hands and turn them into smoke on the altar on top of the burnt offering for a pleasing odor before the Lord. It is an offering by fire to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall take the breast of the ram of Aaron’s ordination and raise it as an elevation offering before the Lord, and it shall be your portion.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall consecrate the breast that was raised as an elevation offering and the thigh that was lifted up as an offering from the ram of ordination, from that which belonged to Aaron and his sons.
speaker: Narrator

text: These things shall be a perpetual ordinance for Aaron and his sons from the Israelites, for this is an offering, and it shall be an offering by the Israelites from their sacrifice of offerings of well-being, their offering to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: “The sacred vestments of Aaron shall be passed on to his sons after him; they shall be anointed in them and ordained in them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The son who is priest in his place shall wear them seven days when he comes into the tent of meeting to minister in the holy place.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall take the ram of ordination and boil its flesh in a holy place,
speaker: Narrator

text: and Aaron and his sons shall eat the flesh of the ram and the bread that is in the basket at the entrance of the tent of meeting.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall eat the food by which atonement is made, to ordain and consecrate them, but no one else shall eat of it, because it is holy.
speaker: Narrator

text: If any of the flesh for the ordination or of the bread remains until the morning, then you shall burn the remainder with fire; it shall not be eaten, because it is holy.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Thus you shall do to Aaron and to his sons, just as I have commanded you; through seven days you shall ordain them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also every day you shall offer a bull as a purification offering for atonement. Also you shall offer a sin offering for the altar, when you make atonement for it, and shall anoint it, to consecrate it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Seven days you shall make atonement for the altar and consecrate it, and the altar shall be most holy; whatever touches the altar shall become holy.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Now this is what you shall offer on the altar: two lambs a year old regularly each day.
speaker: Narrator

text: One lamb you shall offer in the morning, and the other lamb you shall offer in the evening,
speaker: Narrator

text: and with the first lamb one-tenth of a measure of choice flour mixed with one-fourth of a hin of beaten oil, and one-fourth of a hin of wine for a drink offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the other lamb you shall offer in the evening and shall offer with it a grain offering and its drink offering, as in the morning, for a pleasing odor, an offering by fire to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: It shall be a regular burnt offering throughout your generations at the entrance of the tent of meeting before the Lord, where I will meet with you, to speak to you there.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will meet with the Israelites there, and it shall be sanctified by my glory;
speaker: Narrator

text: I will consecrate the tent of meeting and the altar; Aaron also and his sons I will consecrate to serve me as priests.
speaker: Narrator

text: I will dwell among the Israelites, and I will be their God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they shall know that I am the Lord their God, who brought them out of the land of Egypt that I might dwell among them; I am the Lord their God.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall make an altar on which to offer incense; you shall make it of acacia wood.
speaker: Narrator

text: It shall be one cubit long and one cubit wide; it shall be square and shall be two cubits high; its horns shall be of one piece with it.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall overlay it with pure gold, its top and its sides all around and its horns, and you shall make for it a molding of gold all around.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you shall make two golden rings for it; under its molding on two opposite sides of it you shall make them, and they shall hold the poles for carrying it.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall make the poles of acacia wood and overlay them with gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall place it in front of the curtain that is above the ark of the covenant, in front of the cover that is over the covenant, where I will meet with you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Aaron shall offer fragrant incense on it; every morning when he dresses the lamps he shall offer it,
speaker: Narrator

text: and when Aaron sets up the lamps in the evening, he shall offer it, a regular incense offering before the Lord throughout your generations.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall not offer unholy incense on it or a burnt offering or a grain offering, and you shall not pour a drink offering on it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Once a year Aaron shall perform the rite of atonement on its horns. Throughout your generations he shall perform the atonement for it once a year with the blood of the atoning purification offering. It is most holy to the Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses,
speaker: Narrator

text: “When you take a census of the Israelites to register them, at registration all of them shall give a ransom for their lives to the Lord, so that no plague may come upon them for being registered.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is what each one who is registered shall give: half a shekel according to the shekel of the sanctuary (the shekel is twenty gerahs), half a shekel as an offering to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Each one who is registered, from twenty years old and up, shall give the Lord’s offering.
speaker: Narrator

text: The rich shall not give more and the poor shall not give less than the half shekel, when you bring this offering to the Lord to make atonement for your lives.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall take the atonement money from the Israelites and shall designate it for the service of the tent of meeting; before the Lord it will be a reminder to the Israelites of the ransom given for your lives.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses,
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall make a bronze basin with a bronze stand for washing. You shall put it between the tent of meeting and the altar, and you shall put water in it;
speaker: Narrator

text: with the water Aaron and his sons shall wash their hands and their feet.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they go into the tent of meeting or when they come near the altar to minister to make an offering by fire to the Lord, they shall wash with water, so that they may not die.
speaker: Narrator

text: They shall wash their hands and their feet, so that they may not die: it shall be a perpetual ordinance for them, for him and for his descendants throughout their generations.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Take the finest spices: of liquid myrrh five hundred shekels, and of sweet-smelling cinnamon half as much, that is, two hundred fifty, and two hundred fifty of aromatic cane,
speaker: Narrator

text: and five hundred of cassia—measured by the sanctuary shekel—and a hin of olive oil,
speaker: Narrator

text: and you shall make of these a sacred anointing oil blended as by the perfumer; it shall be a holy anointing oil.
speaker: Narrator

text: With it you shall anoint the tent of meeting and the ark of the covenant
speaker: Narrator

text: and the table and all its utensils and the lampstand and its utensils and the altar of incense
speaker: Narrator

text: and the altar of burnt offering with all its utensils and the basin with its stand;
speaker: Narrator

text: you shall consecrate them, so that they may be most holy; whatever touches them will become holy.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall anoint Aaron and his sons and consecrate them to serve me as priests.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall say to the Israelites: This shall be my holy anointing oil throughout your generations.
speaker: Narrator

text: It shall not be used in any ordinary anointing of the body, and you shall make no other like it in composition; it is holy, and it shall be holy to you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoever blends any like it or whoever puts any of it on an unqualified person shall be cut off from the people.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord said to Moses, “Take sweet spices, stacte, and onycha, and galbanum, sweet spices with pure frankincense (an equal part of each),
speaker: Narrator

text: and make an incense blended as by the perfumer, seasoned with salt, pure and holy,
speaker: Narrator

text: and you shall beat some of it into powder and put part of it before the covenant in the tent of meeting, where I shall meet with you; it shall be most holy for you.
speaker: Narrator

text: When you make incense according to this composition, you shall not make it for yourselves; it shall be regarded by you as holy to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whoever makes any like it to use as perfume shall be cut off from the people.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses,
speaker: Narrator

text: “See, I have called by name Bezalel son of Uri son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah,
speaker: Narrator

text: and I have filled him with a divine spirit, with ability, intelligence, and knowledge, and every kind of skill,
speaker: Narrator

text: to devise artistic designs, to work in gold, silver, and bronze,
speaker: Narrator

text: in cutting stones for setting, and in carving wood, to work in every kind of craft.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover, I have appointed with him Oholiab son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan, and I have given skill to all the skillful, so that they may make all that I have commanded you:
speaker: Narrator

text: the tent of meeting, and the ark of the covenant, and the cover that is on it, and all the furnishings of the tent,
speaker: Narrator

text: the table and its utensils, and the pure lampstand with all its utensils, and the altar of incense,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the altar of burnt offering with all its utensils, and the basin with its stand,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the finely worked vestments, the holy vestments for the priest Aaron and the vestments of his sons, for their service as priests,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the anointing oil and the fragrant incense for the holy place. They shall do just as I have commanded you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord said to Moses,
speaker: Narrator

text: “You yourself are to speak to the Israelites, ‘You shall surely keep my Sabbaths, for this is a sign between me and you throughout your generations, given in order that you may know that I, the Lord, sanctify you.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall keep the Sabbath, because it is holy for you; everyone who profanes it shall be put to death; whoever does any work on it shall be cut off from among the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Six days shall work be done, but the seventh day is a Sabbath of solemn rest, holy to the Lord; whoever does any work on the Sabbath day shall be put to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore the Israelites shall keep the Sabbath, observing the Sabbath throughout their generations, as a perpetual covenant.
speaker: Narrator

text: It is a sign forever between me and the Israelites that in six days the Lord made heaven and earth, and on the seventh day he rested and was refreshed.’ ”
speaker: Narrator

text: When God finished speaking with Moses on Mount Sinai, he gave him the two tablets of the covenant, tablets of stone, written with the finger of God.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the people saw that Moses delayed to come down from the mountain, the people gathered around Aaron and said to him, “Come, make gods for us, who shall go before us; as for this Moses, the man who brought us up out of the land of Egypt, we do not know what has become of him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Aaron said to them, “Take off the gold rings that are on the ears of your wives, your sons, and your daughters and bring them to me.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So all the people took off the gold rings from their ears and brought them to Aaron.
speaker: Narrator

text: He took these from them, formed them in a mold, and cast an image of a calf, and they said, “These are your gods, O Israel, who brought you up out of the land of Egypt!”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Aaron saw this, he built an altar before it, and Aaron made a proclamation and said, “Tomorrow shall be a festival to the Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They rose early the next day and offered burnt offerings and brought sacrifices of well-being, and the people sat down to eat and drink and rose up to revel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord said to Moses, “Go down at once! Your people, whom you brought up out of the land of Egypt, have acted perversely;
speaker: Narrator

text: they have been quick to turn aside from the way that I commanded them; they have cast for themselves an image of a calf and have worshiped it and sacrificed to it and said, ‘These are your gods, O Israel, who brought you up out of the land of Egypt!’ ”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord said to Moses, “I have seen this people, how stiff-necked they are.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now let me alone so that my wrath may burn hot against them and I may consume them, and of you I will make a great nation.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Moses implored the Lord his God and said, “O Lord, why does your wrath burn hot against your people, whom you brought out of the land of Egypt with great power and with a mighty hand?
speaker: Narrator

text: Why should the Egyptians say, ‘It was with evil intent that he brought them out to kill them in the mountains and to consume them from the face of the earth’? Turn from your fierce wrath; change your mind and do not bring disaster on your people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember Abraham, Isaac, and Israel, your servants, how you swore to them by your own self, saying to them, ‘I will multiply your descendants like the stars of heaven, and all this land that I have promised I will give to your descendants, and they shall inherit it forever.’ ”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord changed his mind about the disaster that he planned to bring on his people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses turned and went down from the mountain, carrying the two tablets of the covenant in his hands, tablets that were written on both sides, written on the front and on the back.
speaker: Narrator

text: The tablets were the work of God, and the writing was the writing of God, engraved upon the tablets.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Joshua heard the noise of the people as they shouted, he said to Moses, “There is a noise of war in the camp.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
But he said,
“It is not the sound made by victors
or the sound made by losers;
it is the sound of singing that I hear.”
speaker: Narrator

text: As soon as he came near the camp and saw the calf and the dancing, Moses’s anger burned hot, and he threw the tablets from his hands and broke them at the foot of the mountain.
speaker: Narrator

text: He took the calf that they had made, burned it with fire, ground it to powder, scattered it on the water, and made the Israelites drink it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses said to Aaron, “What did this people do to you that you have brought so great a sin upon them?”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Aaron said, “Do not let the anger of my lord burn hot; you know the people, that they are wicked.
speaker: Narrator

text: They said to me, ‘Make gods for us, who shall go before us; as for this Moses, the man who brought us up out of the land of Egypt, we do not know what has become of him.’
speaker: Narrator

text: So I said to them, ‘Whoever has gold, take it off’; so they gave it to me, and I threw it into the fire, and out came this calf!”
speaker: Narrator

text: When Moses saw that the people were out of control (for Aaron had lost control of them, prompting derision among their enemies),
speaker: Narrator

text: then Moses stood in the gate of the camp and said, “Who is on the Lord’s side? Come to me!” And all the sons of Levi gathered around him.
speaker: Narrator

text: He said to them, “Thus says the Lord, the God of Israel: Put your sword on your side, each of you! Go back and forth from gate to gate throughout the camp, and each of you kill your brother, your friend, and your neighbor.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The sons of Levi did as Moses commanded, and about three thousand of the people fell on that day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses said, “Today you have been ordained for the service of the Lord, each one at the cost of a son or a brother, and so have brought a blessing on yourselves this day.”
speaker: Narrator

text: On the next day Moses said to the people, “You have sinned a great sin. But now I will go up to the Lord; perhaps I can make atonement for your sin.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses returned to the Lord and said, “Alas, this people has sinned a great sin; they have made for themselves gods of gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: But now, if you will only forgive their sin—but if not, please blot me out of the book that you have written.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Lord said to Moses, “Whoever has sinned against me I will blot out of my book.
speaker: Narrator

text: But now go, lead the people to the place about which I have spoken to you; see, my angel shall go in front of you. Nevertheless, when the day for punishment comes, I will punish them for their sin.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord sent a plague on the people, because they made the calf—the one that Aaron had made.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord said to Moses, “Go, leave this place, you and the people whom you have brought up out of the land of Egypt, and go to the land of which I swore to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, saying, ‘To your descendants I will give it.’
speaker: Narrator

text: I will send an angel before you, and I will drive out the Canaanites, the Amorites, the Hittites, the Perizzites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites.
speaker: Narrator

text: Go up to a land flowing with milk and honey, but I will not go up among you, or I would consume you on the way, for you are a stiff-necked people.”
speaker: Narrator

text: When the people heard these harsh words, they mourned, and no one put on ornaments.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord had said to Moses, “Say to the Israelites, ‘You are a stiff-necked people; if for a single moment I should go up among you, I would consume you. So now take off your ornaments, and I will decide what to do to you.’ ”
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore the Israelites stripped themselves of their ornaments, from Mount Horeb onward.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Moses used to take the tent and pitch it outside the camp, far off from the camp; he called it the tent of meeting. And everyone who sought the Lord would go out to the tent of meeting, which was outside the camp.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whenever Moses went out to the tent, all the people would rise and stand, each of them, at the entrance of their tents and watch Moses until he had gone into the tent.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Moses entered the tent, the pillar of cloud would descend and stand at the entrance of the tent, and the Lord would speak with Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: When all the people saw the pillar of cloud standing at the entrance of the tent, all the people would rise and bow down, all of them, at the entrance of their tent.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus the Lord used to speak to Moses face to face, as one speaks to a friend. Then he would return to the camp, but his young assistant, Joshua son of Nun, would not leave the tent.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses said to the Lord, “See, you have said to me, ‘Bring up this people,’ but you have not let me know whom you will send with me. Yet you have said, ‘I know you by name, and you have also found favor in my sight.’
speaker: Narrator

text: Now if I have found favor in your sight, please show me your ways, so that I may know you and find favor in your sight. Consider, too, that this nation is your people.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He said, “My presence will go with you, and I will give you rest.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said to him, “If your presence will not go, do not bring us up from here.
speaker: Narrator

text: For how shall it be known that I have found favor in your sight, I and your people, unless you go with us? In this way, we shall be distinct, I and your people, from every people on the face of the earth.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord said to Moses, “I will also do this thing that you have asked, for you have found favor in my sight, and I know you by name.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses said, “Please show me your glory.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, “I will make all my goodness pass before you and will proclaim before you the name, ‘The Lord,’ and I will be gracious to whom I will be gracious and will show mercy on whom I will show mercy.
speaker: Narrator

text: But,” he said, “you cannot see my face, for no one shall see me and live.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord continued, “See, there is a place by me where you shall stand on the rock,
speaker: Narrator

text: and while my glory passes by I will put you in a cleft of the rock, and I will cover you with my hand until I have passed by;
speaker: Narrator

text: then I will take away my hand, and you shall see my back, but my face shall not be seen.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord said to Moses, “Cut two tablets of stone like the former ones, and I will write on the tablets the words that were on the former tablets, which you broke.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be ready in the morning and come up in the morning to Mount Sinai and present yourself there to me on the top of the mountain.
speaker: Narrator

text: No one shall come up with you, and do not let anyone be seen throughout all the mountain, and do not let flocks or herds graze in front of that mountain.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses cut two tablets of stone like the former ones, and he rose early in the morning and went up on Mount Sinai, as the Lord had commanded him, and took in his hand the two tablets of stone.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord descended in the cloud and stood with him there and proclaimed the name, “The Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord passed before him and proclaimed,
“The Lord, the Lord,
a God merciful and gracious,
slow to anger,
and abounding in steadfast love and faithfulness,
speaker: Narrator

text:
keeping steadfast love for the thousandth generation,
forgiving iniquity and transgression and sin,
yet by no means clearing the guilty,
but visiting the iniquity of the parents
upon the children
and the children’s children
to the third and the fourth generation.”
speaker: Narrator

text: And Moses quickly bowed down to the ground and worshiped.
speaker: Narrator

text: He said, “If now I have found favor in your sight, my Lord, I pray, let my Lord go with us. Although this is a stiff-necked people, pardon our iniquity and our sin, and take us for your inheritance.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He said, “I hereby make a covenant. Before all your people I will perform marvels, such as have not been done in all the earth or in any nation, and all the people among whom you live shall see the work of the Lord, for it is an awesome thing that I will do with you.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Observe what I command you today. See, I will drive out before you the Amorites, the Canaanites, the Hittites, the Perizzites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take care not to make a covenant with the inhabitants of the land to which you are going, or it will become a snare among you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Rather, you shall tear down their altars, break their pillars, and cut down their sacred poles,
speaker: Narrator

text: for you shall worship no other god, because the Lord, whose name is Jealous, is a jealous God.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall not make a covenant with the inhabitants of the land, for when they prostitute themselves to their gods and sacrifice to their gods, someone among them will invite you, and you will eat of the sacrifice,
speaker: Narrator

text: and you will take wives from among their daughters for your sons, and their daughters who prostitute themselves to their gods will make your sons also prostitute themselves to their gods.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall not make cast idols.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall keep the Festival of Unleavened Bread. Seven days you shall eat unleavened bread, as I commanded you, at the time appointed in the month of Abib, for in the month of Abib you came out from Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: “All that first opens the womb is mine, all your male livestock, the firstborn of cow and sheep.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The firstborn of a donkey you shall redeem with a lamb, or if you will not redeem it you shall break its neck. All the firstborn of your sons you shall redeem.
“No one shall appear before me empty-handed.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Six days you shall work, but on the seventh day you shall rest; even in plowing time and in harvest time you shall rest.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall observe the Festival of Weeks, the first fruits of wheat harvest, and the Festival of Ingathering at the turn of the year.
speaker: Narrator

text: Three times in the year all your males shall appear before the Lord God, the God of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I will cast out nations before you and enlarge your borders; no one shall covet your land when you go up to appear before the Lord your God three times in the year.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You shall not offer the blood of my sacrifice with leaven, and the sacrifice of the festival of the Passover shall not be left until the morning.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“The best of the first fruits of your ground you shall bring to the house of the Lord your God.
“You shall not boil a kid in its mother’s milk.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord said to Moses, “Write these words, for in accordance with these words I have made a covenant with you and with Israel.”
speaker: Narrator

text: He was there with the Lord forty days and forty nights; he neither ate bread nor drank water. And he wrote on the tablets the words of the covenant, the ten commandments.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses came down from Mount Sinai. As he came down from the mountain with the two tablets of the covenant in his hand, Moses did not know that the skin of his face shone because he had been talking with God.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Aaron and all the Israelites saw Moses, the skin of his face was shining, and they were afraid to come near him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Moses called to them, and Aaron and all the leaders of the congregation returned to him, and Moses spoke with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Afterward all the Israelites came near, and he gave them in commandment all that the Lord had spoken with him on Mount Sinai.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Moses had finished speaking with them, he put a veil on his face,
speaker: Narrator

text: but whenever Moses went in before the Lord to speak with him, he would take the veil off until he came out, and when he came out and told the Israelites what he had been commanded,
speaker: Narrator

text: the Israelites would see the face of Moses, that the skin of his face was shining, and Moses would put the veil on his face again until he went in to speak with him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses assembled all the congregation of the Israelites and said to them, “These are the things that the Lord has commanded you to do:
speaker: Narrator

text: “Six days shall work be done, but on the seventh day you shall have a holy Sabbath of solemn rest to the Lord; whoever does any work on it shall be put to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall kindle no fire in all your dwellings on the Sabbath day.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses said to all the congregation of the Israelites, “This is the thing that the Lord has commanded:
speaker: Narrator

text: Take from among you an offering to the Lord; let whoever is of a generous heart bring the Lord’s offering: gold, silver, and bronze;
speaker: Narrator

text: blue, purple, and crimson yarns and fine linen; goats’ hair,
speaker: Narrator

text: tanned rams’ skins, and fine leather; acacia wood,
speaker: Narrator

text: oil for the light, spices for the anointing oil and for the fragrant incense,
speaker: Narrator

text: and onyx stones and gems to be set in the ephod and the breastpiece.
speaker: Narrator

text: “All who are skillful among you shall come and make all that the Lord has commanded:
speaker: Narrator

text: the tabernacle, its tent and its covering, its clasps and its frames, its bars, its pillars, and its bases;
speaker: Narrator

text: the ark with its poles, the cover, and the curtain for the screen;
speaker: Narrator

text: the table with its poles and all its utensils and the bread of the Presence;
speaker: Narrator

text: and the lampstand for the light, with its utensils and its lamps and the oil for the light;
speaker: Narrator

text: and the altar of incense, with its poles, and the anointing oil and the fragrant incense, and the screen for the entrance, the entrance of the tabernacle;
speaker: Narrator

text: the altar of burnt offering, with its grating of bronze, its poles, and all its utensils, the basin with its stand;
speaker: Narrator

text: the hangings of the court, its pillars and its bases, and the screen for the gate of the court;
speaker: Narrator

text: the pegs of the tabernacle and the pegs of the court and their cords;
speaker: Narrator

text: the finely worked vestments for ministering in the holy place, the holy vestments for the priest Aaron, and the vestments of his sons, for their service as priests.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then all the congregation of the Israelites withdrew from the presence of Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they came, everyone whose heart was stirred and everyone whose spirit was willing, and brought the Lord’s offering to be used for the tent of meeting and for all its service and for the sacred vestments.
speaker: Narrator

text: So they came, both men and women; all who were of a willing heart brought brooches and earrings and signet rings and pendants, all sorts of gold objects, everyone bringing an offering of gold to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And everyone who possessed blue or purple or crimson yarn or fine linen or goats’ hair or tanned rams’ skins or fine leather brought them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Everyone who could make an offering of silver or bronze brought it as the Lord’s offering, and everyone who possessed acacia wood of any use in the work brought it.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the skillful women spun with their hands and brought what they had spun in blue and purple and crimson yarns and fine linen;
speaker: Narrator

text: all the women whose hearts moved them to use their skill spun the goats’ hair.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the leaders brought onyx stones and gems to be set in the ephod and the breastpiece
speaker: Narrator

text: and spices and oil for the light and for the anointing oil and for the fragrant incense.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the Israelite men and women whose hearts made them willing to bring anything for the work that the Lord had commanded by Moses to be done brought it as a freewill offering to the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Moses said to the Israelites, “See, the Lord has called by name Bezalel son of Uri son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah;
speaker: Narrator

text: he has filled him with a divine spirit, with ability, intelligence, and knowledge, and with every kind of skill,
speaker: Narrator

text: to devise artistic designs, to work in gold, silver, and bronze,
speaker: Narrator

text: in cutting stones for setting, and in carving wood, in every kind of artistic craft.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he has inspired him to teach, both him and Oholiab son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan.
speaker: Narrator

text: He has filled them with skill to do every kind of work done by an artisan or by a designer or by an embroiderer in blue, purple, and crimson yarns and in fine linen or by a weaver—by any sort of skilled worker or designer.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Bezalel and Oholiab and every skilled person to whom the Lord has given skill and understanding to know how to do any work in the construction of the sanctuary shall work in accordance with all that the Lord has commanded.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses then called Bezalel and Oholiab and every skilled person to whom the Lord had given skill, everyone whose heart was stirred to come to do the work,
speaker: Narrator

text: and they received from Moses all the offerings that the Israelites had brought for the work of constructing the sanctuary. They still kept bringing him freewill offerings every morning,
speaker: Narrator

text: so that all the skilled workers who were doing every sort of task on the sanctuary came, each from the task being performed,
speaker: Narrator

text: and said to Moses, “The people are bringing much more than enough for doing the work that the Lord has commanded us to do.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses gave command, and word was proclaimed throughout the camp: “No man or woman is to make anything else as an offering for the sanctuary.” So the people were restrained from bringing,
speaker: Narrator

text: for what they had already brought was more than enough to do all the work.
speaker: Narrator

text: All those with skill among the workers made the tabernacle with ten curtains; they were made of fine twisted linen and blue, purple, and crimson yarns, with cherubim skillfully worked into them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The length of each curtain was twenty-eight cubits and the width of each curtain four cubits; all the curtains were of the same size.
speaker: Narrator

text: He joined five curtains to one another, and the other five curtains he joined to one another.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made loops of blue on the edge of the outermost curtain of the first set; likewise he made them on the edge of the outermost curtain of the second set;
speaker: Narrator

text: he made fifty loops on the one curtain, and he made fifty loops on the edge of the curtain that was in the second set; the loops were opposite one another.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made fifty clasps of gold and joined the curtains one to the other with clasps; so the tabernacle was one whole.
speaker: Narrator

text: He also made curtains of goats’ hair for a tent over the tabernacle; he made eleven curtains.
speaker: Narrator

text: The length of each curtain was thirty cubits and the width of each curtain four cubits; the eleven curtains were of the same size.
speaker: Narrator

text: He joined five curtains by themselves and six curtains by themselves.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made fifty loops on the edge of the outermost curtain of the one set and fifty loops on the edge of the other connecting curtain.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made fifty clasps of bronze to join the tent together so that it might be one whole.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made for the tent a covering of tanned rams’ skins and an outer covering of fine leather.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he made the upright frames for the tabernacle of acacia wood.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ten cubits was the length of a frame and a cubit and a half the width of each frame.
speaker: Narrator

text: Each frame had two pegs for fitting together; he did this for all the frames of the tabernacle.
speaker: Narrator

text: The frames for the tabernacle he made in this way: twenty frames for the south side,
speaker: Narrator

text: and he made forty bases of silver under the twenty frames, two bases under the first frame for its two pegs and two bases under the next frame for its two pegs.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the second side of the tabernacle, on the north side, he made twenty frames
speaker: Narrator

text: and their forty bases of silver, two bases under the first frame and two bases under the next frame.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the rear of the tabernacle westward he made six frames.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made two frames for the corners of the tabernacle in the rear.
speaker: Narrator

text: They were separate beneath but joined at the top at the first ring; he made two of them in this way for the two corners.
speaker: Narrator

text: There were eight frames with their bases of silver: sixteen bases, under every frame two bases.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made bars of acacia wood: five for the frames of the one side of the tabernacle,
speaker: Narrator

text: and five bars for the frames of the other side of the tabernacle, and five bars for the frames of the tabernacle at the rear westward.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made the middle bar to pass through from end to end halfway up the frames.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he overlaid the frames with gold and made rings of gold for them to hold the bars and overlaid the bars with gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made the curtain of blue, purple, and crimson yarns and fine twisted linen, with cherubim skillfully worked into it.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made for it four pillars of acacia and overlaid them with gold; their hooks were of gold, and he cast for them four bases of silver.
speaker: Narrator

text: He also made a screen for the entrance to the tent, of blue, purple, and crimson yarns and fine twisted linen, embroidered with needlework,
speaker: Narrator

text: and its five pillars with their hooks. He overlaid their capitals and their bases with gold, but their five bases were of bronze.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bezalel made the ark of acacia wood; it was two and a half cubits long, a cubit and a half wide, and a cubit and a half high.
speaker: Narrator

text: He overlaid it with pure gold inside and outside and made a molding of gold around it.
speaker: Narrator

text: He cast for it four rings of gold for its four feet, two rings on its one side and two rings on its other side.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made poles of acacia wood and overlaid them with gold
speaker: Narrator

text: and put the poles into the rings on the sides of the ark, to carry the ark.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made a cover of pure gold; two cubits and a half was its length and a cubit and a half its width.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made two cherubim of hammered gold; at the two ends of the cover he made them,
speaker: Narrator

text: one cherub at one end and one cherub at the other end; of one piece with the cover he made the cherubim at its two ends.
speaker: Narrator

text: The cherubim spread out their wings above, overshadowing the cover with their wings. They faced one another; the faces of the cherubim were turned toward the cover.
speaker: Narrator

text: He also made the table of acacia wood, two cubits long, one cubit wide, and a cubit and a half high.
speaker: Narrator

text: He overlaid it with pure gold and made a molding of gold around it.
speaker: Narrator

text: He also made around it a rim a handbreadth wide, and he made a molding of gold around the rim.
speaker: Narrator

text: He cast for it four rings of gold and fastened the rings to the four corners at its four legs.
speaker: Narrator

text: The rings that held the poles used for carrying the table were close to the rim.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made the poles of acacia wood to carry the table and overlaid them with gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made the vessels of pure gold that were to be on the table, its plates and dishes for incense and its bowls and flagons with which to pour drink offerings.
speaker: Narrator

text: He also made the lampstand of pure gold. The base and the shaft of the lampstand were made of hammered work; its cups, its calyxes, and its petals were of one piece with it.
speaker: Narrator

text: There were six branches going out of its sides, three branches of the lampstand out of one side of it and three branches of the lampstand out of the other side of it;
speaker: Narrator

text: three cups shaped like almond blossoms, each with calyx and petals, on one branch, and three cups shaped like almond blossoms, each with calyx and petals, on the other branch—so for the six branches going out of the lampstand.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the lampstand itself there were four cups shaped like almond blossoms, each with its calyxes and petals.
speaker: Narrator

text: There was a calyx of one piece with it under the first pair of branches, a calyx of one piece with it under the next pair of branches, and a calyx of one piece with it under the last pair of branches—so for the six branches going out of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their calyxes and their branches were of one piece with it, the whole of it one hammered piece of pure gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made its seven lamps and its snuffers and its trays of pure gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made it and all its utensils of a talent of pure gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made the altar of incense of acacia wood, one cubit long and one cubit wide; it was square and was two cubits high; its horns were of one piece with it.
speaker: Narrator

text: He overlaid it with pure gold, its top and its sides all around and its horns, and he made a molding of gold around it
speaker: Narrator

text: and two golden rings for it under its molding, on two opposite sides of it, to hold the poles with which to carry it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made the poles of acacia wood and overlaid them with gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made the holy anointing oil also and the pure fragrant incense, blended as by the perfumer.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made the altar of burnt offering of acacia wood; it was five cubits long and five cubits wide; it was square and was three cubits high.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made horns for it on its four corners; its horns were of one piece with it, and he overlaid it with bronze.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made all the utensils of the altar: the pots, the shovels, the basins, the forks, and the firepans; all its utensils he made of bronze.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made for the altar a grating, a network of bronze, under its ledge, extending halfway down.
speaker: Narrator

text: He cast four rings on the four corners of the bronze grating to hold the poles;
speaker: Narrator

text: he made the poles of acacia wood and overlaid them with bronze.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he put the poles through the rings on the sides of the altar, to carry it with them; he made it hollow, with boards.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made the basin of bronze with its stand of bronze, from the mirrors of the women who served at the entrance to the tent of meeting.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made the court; for the south side the hangings of the court were of fine twisted linen, one hundred cubits long;
speaker: Narrator

text: its twenty pillars and their twenty bases were of bronze, but the hooks of the pillars and their bands were of silver.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the north side there were hangings one hundred cubits long; its twenty pillars and their twenty bases were of bronze, but the hooks of the pillars and their bands were of silver.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the west side there were hangings fifty cubits long, with ten pillars and ten bases; the hooks of the pillars and their bands were of silver.
speaker: Narrator

text: And for the front to the east, fifty cubits.
speaker: Narrator

text: The hangings for one side of the gate were fifteen cubits, with three pillars and three bases.
speaker: Narrator

text: And likewise for the other side: on each side of the gate of the court were hangings of fifteen cubits, with three pillars and three bases.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the hangings around the court were of fine twisted linen.
speaker: Narrator

text: The bases for the pillars were of bronze, but the hooks of the pillars and their bands were of silver; the overlaying of their capitals was also of silver, and all the pillars of the court were banded with silver.
speaker: Narrator

text: The screen for the entrance to the court was embroidered with needlework in blue, purple, and crimson yarns and fine twisted linen. It was twenty cubits long and, along the width of it, five cubits high, corresponding to the hangings of the court.
speaker: Narrator

text: There were four pillars; their four bases were of bronze, their hooks of silver, and the overlaying of their capitals and their bands of silver.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the pegs for the tabernacle and for the court all around were of bronze.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the records of the tabernacle, the tabernacle of the covenant, which were drawn up at the commandment of Moses, the work of the Levites being under the direction of Ithamar son of the priest Aaron.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bezalel son of Uri son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah, made all that the Lord commanded Moses,
speaker: Narrator

text: and with him was Oholiab son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan, engraver, designer, and embroiderer in blue, purple, and crimson yarns and in fine linen.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the gold that was used for the work, in all the construction of the sanctuary, the gold from the offering, was twenty-nine talents and seven hundred thirty shekels, measured by the sanctuary shekel.
speaker: Narrator

text: The silver from those of the congregation who were counted was one hundred talents and one thousand seven hundred seventy-five shekels, measured by the sanctuary shekel,
speaker: Narrator

text: a beka a head (that is, half a shekel, measured by the sanctuary shekel) for everyone who was counted in the census, from twenty years old and up, for six hundred three thousand, five hundred fifty men.
speaker: Narrator

text: The hundred talents of silver were for casting the bases of the sanctuary and the bases of the curtain, one hundred bases for the hundred talents, one talent per base.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the thousand seven hundred seventy-five shekels he made hooks for the pillars and overlaid their capitals and made bands for them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The bronze offering was seventy talents and two thousand four hundred shekels;
speaker: Narrator

text: with it he made the bases for the entrance of the tent of meeting, the bronze altar and the bronze grating for it and all the utensils of the altar,
speaker: Narrator

text: the bases all around the court, and the bases of the gate of the court, all the pegs of the tabernacle, and all the pegs around the court.
speaker: Narrator

text: Of the blue, purple, and crimson yarns they made finely worked vestments, for ministering in the holy place; they made the sacred vestments for Aaron, as the Lord had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made the ephod of gold, of blue, purple, and crimson yarns, and of fine twisted linen.
speaker: Narrator

text: Gold leaf was hammered out and cut into threads to work into the blue, purple, and crimson yarns and into the fine twisted linen, in skilled design.
speaker: Narrator

text: They made for the ephod shoulder pieces, joined to it at its two edges.
speaker: Narrator

text: The decorated band on it was of the same materials and workmanship, of gold, of blue, purple, and crimson yarns, and of fine twisted linen, as the Lord had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: The onyx stones were prepared, enclosed in settings of gold filigree and engraved like the engravings of a signet, according to the names of the sons of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: He set them on the shoulder pieces of the ephod, to be stones of remembrance for the sons of Israel, as the Lord had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made the breastpiece, in skilled work, like the work of the ephod, of gold, of blue, purple, and crimson yarns, and of fine twisted linen.
speaker: Narrator

text: It was square; the breastpiece was made double, a span in length and a span in width when doubled.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set in it four rows of stones. A row of carnelian, chrysolite, and emerald was the first row;
speaker: Narrator

text: and the second row, a turquoise, a sapphire, and a moonstone;
speaker: Narrator

text: and the third row, a jacinth, an agate, and an amethyst;
speaker: Narrator

text: and the fourth row, a beryl, an onyx, and a jasper; they were enclosed in settings of gold filigree.
speaker: Narrator

text: There were twelve stones with names corresponding to the names of the sons of Israel; they were engraved like signets, each with its name, for the twelve tribes.
speaker: Narrator

text: They made on the breastpiece chains of pure gold, twisted like cords,
speaker: Narrator

text: and they made two settings of gold filigree and two gold rings and put the two rings on the two edges of the breastpiece,
speaker: Narrator

text: and they put the two cords of gold in the two rings at the edges of the breastpiece.
speaker: Narrator

text: Two ends of the two cords they had attached to the two settings of filigree; in this way they attached it in front to the shoulder pieces of the ephod.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they made two rings of gold and put them at the two ends of the breastpiece, on its inside edge next to the ephod.
speaker: Narrator

text: They made two rings of gold and attached them in front to the lower part of the two shoulder pieces of the ephod, at its joining above the decorated band of the ephod.
speaker: Narrator

text: They bound the breastpiece by its rings to the rings of the ephod with a blue cord, so that it should lie on the decorated band of the ephod and that the breastpiece should not come loose from the ephod, as the Lord had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: He also made the robe of the ephod woven all of blue yarn,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the opening of the robe in the middle of it was like the opening in a garment, with a binding around its edge, so that it might not be torn.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the lower hem of the robe they made pomegranates of blue, purple, and crimson yarns and of fine twisted linen.
speaker: Narrator

text: They also made bells of pure gold and put the bells between the pomegranates on the lower hem of the robe all around, between the pomegranates,
speaker: Narrator

text: a bell and a pomegranate, a bell and a pomegranate all around on the lower hem of the robe for ministering, as the Lord had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: They also made the tunics, woven of fine linen, for Aaron and his sons,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the turban of fine linen, and the headdresses of fine linen, and the linen undergarments of fine twisted linen,
speaker: Narrator

text: and the sash of fine twisted linen, and of blue, purple, and crimson yarns, embroidered with needlework, as the Lord had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: They made the rosette of the holy diadem of pure gold and wrote on it an inscription, like the engraving of a signet, “Holy to the Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They tied to it a blue cord, to fasten it on the turban above, as the Lord had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus all the work of the tabernacle of the tent of meeting was finished; the Israelites had done everything just as the Lord had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they brought the tabernacle to Moses, the tent and all its utensils, its clasps, its frames, its bars, its pillars, and its bases;
speaker: Narrator

text: the covering of tanned rams’ skins and the covering of fine leather and the curtain for the screen;
speaker: Narrator

text: the ark of the covenant with its poles and the cover;
speaker: Narrator

text: the table with all its utensils and the bread of the Presence;
speaker: Narrator

text: the pure lampstand with its lamps set on it and all its utensils and the oil for the light;
speaker: Narrator

text: the golden altar, the anointing oil and the fragrant incense, and the screen for the entrance of the tent;
speaker: Narrator

text: the bronze altar and its grating of bronze, its poles, and all its utensils; the basin with its stand;
speaker: Narrator

text: the hangings of the court, its pillars, and its bases, and the screen for the gate of the court, its cords, and its pegs; and all the utensils for the service of the tabernacle, for the tent of meeting;
speaker: Narrator

text: the finely worked vestments for ministering in the holy place, the sacred vestments for the priest Aaron, and the vestments of his sons to serve as priests.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Israelites had done all of the work as the Lord had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Moses saw that they had done all the work as the Lord had commanded, he blessed them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord spoke to Moses,
speaker: Narrator

text: “On the first day of the first month you shall set up the tabernacle of the tent of meeting.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall put in it the ark of the covenant, and you shall screen the ark with the curtain.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall bring in the table and arrange its setting, and you shall bring in the lampstand and set up its lamps.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall put the golden altar for incense before the ark of the covenant and set up the screen for the entrance of the tabernacle.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall set the altar of burnt offering before the entrance of the tabernacle of the tent of meeting
speaker: Narrator

text: and place the basin between the tent of meeting and the altar and put water in it.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall set up the court all around and hang up the screen for the gate of the court.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then you shall take the anointing oil and anoint the tabernacle and all that is in it and consecrate it and all its furniture, so that it shall become holy.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall also anoint the altar of burnt offering and all its utensils and consecrate the altar, so that the altar shall be most holy.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall also anoint the basin with its stand and consecrate it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then you shall bring Aaron and his sons to the entrance of the tent of meeting and wash them with water
speaker: Narrator

text: and put on Aaron the sacred vestments, and you shall anoint him and consecrate him, so that he may serve me as priest.
speaker: Narrator

text: You shall bring his sons also and put tunics on them
speaker: Narrator

text: and anoint them, as you anointed their father, that they may serve me as priests; their anointing shall admit them to a perpetual priesthood throughout all their generations.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses did everything just as the Lord had commanded him.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the first month in the second year, on the first day of the month, the tabernacle was set up.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses set up the tabernacle; he laid its bases and set up its frames and put in its poles and raised up its pillars,
speaker: Narrator

text: and he spread the tent over the tabernacle and put the covering of the tent over it as the Lord had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: He took the covenant and put it into the ark and put the poles on the ark and set the cover above the ark,
speaker: Narrator

text: and he brought the ark into the tabernacle and set up the curtain for screening and screened the ark of the covenant as the Lord had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: He put the table in the tent of meeting, on the north side of the tabernacle, outside the curtain,
speaker: Narrator

text: and set the bread in order on it before the Lord as the Lord had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: He put the lampstand in the tent of meeting, opposite the table on the south side of the tabernacle,
speaker: Narrator

text: and set up the lamps before the Lord as the Lord had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: He put the golden altar in the tent of meeting before the curtain
speaker: Narrator

text: and offered fragrant incense on it as the Lord had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: He also put in place the screen for the entrance of the tabernacle.
speaker: Narrator

text: He set the altar of burnt offering at the entrance of the tabernacle of the tent of meeting and offered on it the burnt offering and the grain offering as the Lord had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: He set the basin between the tent of meeting and the altar and put water in it for washing,
speaker: Narrator

text: with which Moses and Aaron and his sons washed their hands and their feet.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they went into the tent of meeting and when they approached the altar, they washed as the Lord had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: He set up the court around the tabernacle and the altar and put up the screen at the gate of the court. So Moses finished the work.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the cloud covered the tent of meeting, and the glory of the Lord filled the tabernacle.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses was not able to enter the tent of meeting because the cloud settled upon it, and the glory of the Lord filled the tabernacle.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whenever the cloud was taken up from the tabernacle, the Israelites would set out on each stage of their journey,
speaker: Narrator

text: but if the cloud was not taken up, then they did not set out until the day that it was taken up.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the cloud of the Lord was on the tabernacle by day, and fire was in the cloud by night, before the eyes of all the house of Israel at each stage of their journey.
speaker: Narrator
